Pack prettified data.frame of tokens

Source: R/pack.R
pack.Rd

Pack a prettified data.frame of tokens into a new data.frame of corpus, which is compatible with the Text Interchange Formats.

pack(df, n = 1L, skip = 0L, pull = "token", sep = "_", .collapse = " ")

Arguments

df

A prettified data.frame of tokens.
n

Integer passed to quanteda::char_ngrams().
skip

Integer passed to quanteda::char_ngrams().
pull

Column to be packed into text or ngrams body. Default value is `token`.
sep

Character scalar internally used as the concatenator of ngrams inside quanteda::char_ngrams.
.collapse

This argument is passed to stringi::stri_c().

Value

A data.frame.

Text Interchange Formats (TIF)

The Text Interchange Formats (TIF) are a set of standards that allows R text analysis packages to target defined inputs and outputs for corpora, tokens, and document-term matrices.

Valid data.frame of tokens

The prettified data.frame of tokens here is a data.frame object compatible with the TIF.

A TIF valid data.frame of tokens are expected to have one unique key column (named `doc_id`) of each text and several feature columns of each tokens. The feature columns must contain at least `token` itself.

See also

https://github.com/ropensci/tif
